creator: thangalin@gmail.com
text:
The documentation for the security-related directives (such as ServerTokens) does not explicitly state the name of the file.

Recommendation: Put a note in the documentation stating that changing ServerTokens must be done in conf.d/security rather than the default configuration file (e.g., apach2.conf).

Ubuntu Linux.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: You'd have to ask Ubuntu, or a user support list, about the significance of those filenames.  Apache HTTP Server doesn't care what file it's in, it only cares that the context is "server config" which is already in the manual.
